paper_abstract: We consider the quanti fied constraint satisfaction problem (QCSP) which is to decide, given a structure and a first-order sentence (not assumed here to be in prenex form) built from conjunction and quanti fication, whether or not the sentence is true on the structure. We present a proof system for certifying the falsity of QCSP instances and develop its basic theory; for instance, we provide an algorithmic interpretation of its behavior. Our proof system places the established Q-resolution proof system in a broader context, and also allows us to derive QCSP tractability results.
paper_title: BEYOND Q-RESOLUTION AND PRENEX FORM: A PROOF SYSTEM FOR QUANTIFIED CONSTRAINT SATISFACTION
